## Useful Info

**Ancient liches** are extremely powerful undead casters with a wide array of resistances and access to brutal conjurations that can deal ridiculous amounts of damage. If you are not confident in your skills, escape is strongly advised.

Ancient liches can rarely be found on the last floor of [the Vaults](/The_Vaults "The Vaults"), in [the Abyss](/The_Abyss "The Abyss"), [the Crypt](/The_Crypt "The Crypt"), [the Tomb](/The_Tomb "The Tomb"), and [the Realm of Zot](/The_Realm_of_Zot "The Realm of Zot"). They are a particularly common sight near the orb chamber of [Zot:5](/Zot:5 "Zot:5").

## Spells

| Spell set I |                                                                                        |                                                     |
| :---------- | -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | --------------------------------------------------- |
| Slot1       | [Corrosive Bolt](/Corrosive_Bolt "Corrosive Bolt") (3d34)                              | [Wizard flag](/Spell_slot_flags "Spell slot flags") |
| Slot2       | [Lehudib's Crystal Spear](/Lehudib%27s_Crystal_Spear "Lehudib's Crystal Spear") (3d48) | [Wizard flag](/Spell_slot_flags "Spell slot flags") |
| Slot3       | [Haste](/Haste "Haste")                                                                | [Wizard flag](/Spell_slot_flags "Spell slot flags") |
| Slot4       | [Petrify](/Petrify "Petrify")                                                          | [Wizard flag](/Spell_slot_flags "Spell slot flags") |
| Slot5       | [Invisibility](/Invisibility "Invisibility")                                           | [Wizard flag](/Spell_slot_flags "Spell slot flags") |

## Strategy

Understand that ancient liches are some of the most powerful casters in the game. Don't worry too much about conserving resources; if burning a consumable or two will greatly ease the battle, do so. A [hasted](/Haste "Haste") ancient lich can deal up to 288 damage per turn, enough to one-round most characters. While this max damage is exceedingly rare, ancient liches can still cause huge spikes of damage. Taking 100+ damage in a single turn stings.

As these liches resist most elemental damage, casters should use pure [Conjurations](/Conjurations "Conjurations") or [Earth Magic](/Earth_Magic "Earth Magic") to deal with them. Necromancy users can use [Dispel Undead](/Dispel_Undead "Dispel Undead"). Melee fighters should lure them around corners or use a [scroll of fog](/Scroll_of_fog "Scroll of fog"). If available, a strong [holy wrath](/Holy_wrath "Holy wrath") or [antimagic](/Antimagic "Antimagic") weapon works great.

### Tips & Tricks

- Ancient liches are spellcasters, so are vulnerable to both [silence](/Silence "Silence") and [antimagic](/Antimagic "Antimagic"). When silenced, all it can do is make weak melee attacks, which is only dangerous to players at low HP. Weapons of antimagic and [Enfeeble](/Enfeeble "Enfeeble") are also effective at disabling them.
- [Berserk](/Berserk "Berserk") can work well, as liches don't blink. However, ancient liches usually generate in areas you don't want attention (Vaults:5 and Zot:5). Being [slowed](/Slow "Slow") when an [orb of fire](/Orb_of_fire "Orb of fire") comes into view isn't exactly a great situation.
- Like most enemies in Crawl, ancient liches are vulnerable to [throwing nets](/Throwing_net "Throwing net"). Throwing a net at the edge of [LOS](/LOS "LOS") guarantees that you can run away. Nets also allow for [stab](/Stab "Stab") attempts.

## History

- Prior to [0.27](/0.27 "0.27"), ancient liches could have one of several spell sets. In particular, the [Summoning](/Summoning "Summoning")-focused spells were given to the newly-introduced [dread liches](/Dread_lich "Dread lich").

  - [Bolt of Cold](/Bolt_of_Cold "Bolt of Cold") (3d37), [Force Lance](/Force_Lance "Force Lance") (3d27), [Summon Greater Demon](/Summon_Greater_Demon "Summon Greater Demon"), [Slow](/Slow "Slow"), [Invisibility](/Invisibility "Invisibility")
  - [Bolt of Draining](/Bolt_of_Draining "Bolt of Draining") (3d33), [Poison Arrow](/Poison_Arrow "Poison Arrow") (3d34), [Haunt](/Haunt "Haunt"), [Banishment](/Banishment "Banishment"), [Haste](/Haste "Haste")
  - [Bolt of Fire](/Bolt_of_Fire "Bolt of Fire") (3d37), [Iron Shot](/Iron_Shot "Iron Shot") (3d44), Summon Greater Demon, [Confuse](/Confuse "Confuse"), Invisibility
  - [Corrosive Bolt](/Corrosive_Bolt "Corrosive Bolt") (3d28), [Lehudib's Crystal Spear](/Lehudib%27s_Crystal_Spear "Lehudib's Crystal Spear") (3d48), [Petrify](/Petrify "Petrify"), Haste
  - [Lightning Bolt](/Lightning_Bolt "Lightning Bolt") (3d29), [Orb of Destruction](/Orb_of_Destruction "Orb of Destruction") (9d20), [Paralyze](/Paralyze "Paralyze"), Haste

- Prior to [0.18](/0.18 "0.18"), ancient liches had randomized spell sets.

- Prior to [0.16](/0.16 "0.16"), ancient liches would generate with one of four predetermined spell sets.

Useful Info

Ancient liches are extremely powerful undead casters with a wide array of resistances and access to brutal conjurations that can deal ridiculous amounts of damage. If you are not confident in your skills, escape is strongly advised.

Ancient liches can rarely be found on the last floor of the Vaults, in the Abyss, the Crypt, the Tomb, and the Realm of Zot. They are a particularly common sight near the orb chamber of Zot:5.

Spells

Spell set I
Slot1 Corrosive Bolt (3d34) Wizard flag
Slot2 Lehudib's Crystal Spear (3d48) Wizard flag
Slot3 Haste Wizard flag
Slot4 Petrify Wizard flag
Slot5 Invisibility Wizard flag

Strategy

Understand that ancient liches are some of the most powerful casters in the game. Don't worry too much about conserving resources; if burning a consumable or two will greatly ease the battle, do so. A hasted ancient lich can deal up to 288 damage per turn, enough to one-round most characters. While this max damage is exceedingly rare, ancient liches can still cause huge spikes of damage. Taking 100+ damage in a single turn stings.

As these liches resist most elemental damage, casters should use pure Conjurations or Earth Magic to deal with them. Necromancy users can use Dispel Undead. Melee fighters should lure them around corners or use a scroll of fog. If available, a strong holy wrath or antimagic weapon works great.

Tips & Tricks

  • Ancient liches are spellcasters, so are vulnerable to both silence and antimagic. When silenced, all it can do is make weak melee attacks, which is only dangerous to players at low HP. Weapons of antimagic and Enfeeble are also effective at disabling them.
  • Berserk can work well, as liches don't blink. However, ancient liches usually generate in areas you don't want attention (Vaults:5 and Zot:5). Being slowed when an orb of fire comes into view isn't exactly a great situation.
  • Like most enemies in Crawl, ancient liches are vulnerable to throwing nets. Throwing a net at the edge of LOS guarantees that you can run away. Nets also allow for stab attempts.

History

  • Prior to 0.27, ancient liches could have one of several spell sets. In particular, the Summoning-focused spells were given to the newly-introduced dread liches.
    • Bolt of Cold (3d37), Force Lance (3d27), Summon Greater Demon, Slow, Invisibility
    • Bolt of Draining (3d33), Poison Arrow (3d34), Haunt, Banishment, Haste
    • Bolt of Fire (3d37), Iron Shot (3d44), Summon Greater Demon, Confuse, Invisibility
    • Corrosive Bolt (3d28), Lehudib's Crystal Spear (3d48), Petrify, Haste
    • Lightning Bolt (3d29), Orb of Destruction (9d20), Paralyze, Haste
  • Prior to 0.18, ancient liches had randomized spell sets.
  • Prior to 0.16, ancient liches would generate with one of four predetermined spell sets.
